name: Kepler-157
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-157 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-157 is a star with 1.0070000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.04 times its radius. It is located 2580.77 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-157 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-157 b

Kepler-157 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 1.73 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-157.

The mass of Kepler-157 b is 1.88 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-157 b is 1.32 that of Earth. At 1.88 Earth masses, Kepler-157 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-157 c

Kepler-157 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.11 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 13.54 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-157.

The mass of Kepler-157 c is 6.68 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-157 c is 2.24 that of Earth. At 6.68 Earth masses, Kepler-157 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-157, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
